page.title: 08HORTICULTURE (NEWICK AREA)
page.content: Horticulture has for many years been a feature of Newick life. With the decline in hop growing at the end of the last century, market gardening and soft fruit growing was introduced. A wide variety of vegetables and fruits were grown. Strawberries, raspberries and the famous Newick Leveller goose- berries flourished. This industry is however already on the decline, as such perishable goods are now trans- ported easily and more cheaply from abroad. A new industry has developed, that of selling the excellent, disease-free strawberry plants to Italy, France and Spain. The plants are lifted in March and stored in freezers at exactly -1 degree centigrade, ready for export.
